alert.note: Alert for Butler; Cowley; Elk; Greenwood; Harper; Sumner (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 4:26AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Elk, Cowley, southern Butler, Harper, Sumner and southwestern Greenwood Counties through 500 AM CDT... At 426 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles northeast of Leon to near Udall to near Caldwell to 5 miles south of Hazelton. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... El Dorado, Arkansas City, Winfield, Augusta, Wellington, Anthony, Douglass, Belle Plaine, Harper, Towanda, Conway Springs, Caldwell, Oxford, Udall, Leon, Attica, Burden, Argonia, South Haven and Dexter. This includes Interstate 35 between Mile Markers 1 and 31, and between Mile Markers 60 and 75. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Butler; Cowley; Elk; Greenwood; Harper; Sumner
